Prerequisites: (A) MAC 1105 OR EQUIVALENT OR HIGHER-LEVEL COURSE WITH A GRADE OF 'C' OR HIGHER; AND (B) MINIMUM 30 CREDITS EARNED; AND (C) BUSINESS STUDENTS ONLY
Course Description: ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS AND ANALYSES ESSENTIAL TO DETERMINING THE INCOME AND FINANCIAL POSITION OF A BUSINESS ENTERPRISE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COURSE OBJECTIVES:
STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. DESCRIBE THE GENERAL PURPOSE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ACCORDING TO GENERAL ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (GAAP)
2. EXPLAIN THE CONCEPT OF ACCRUAL VS. CASH BASIS ACCOUNTING
3. PRACTICE USING FINANCIAL DATA IN THE PREPARATION OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
4. IDENTIFY AND EXPLAIN THE PROFESSIONAL ETHICS NECESSARY IN THE ACCOUNTANT'S PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITIES.
5. APPLY INTRODUCTORY KNOWLEDGE OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS

MAJOR TOPICS
1. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
2. TRANSACTION ANALYSIS
3. ACCRUAL ACCOUNTING & INCOME
4. INTERNAL CONTROL & CASH
5. SHORT-TERM INVESTMENTS AND
RECEIVABLES
6. INVENTORY & COST OF GOODS SOLD
7. PLANT ASSETS, NATURAL RESOURCES, & INTANGIBLES
8. LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS & THE TIME
VALUE OF MONEY
9. LIABILITIES
10. STOCKHOLDER'S EQUITY
11. EARNINGS QUALITY, THE INCOME STATEMENT & THE STATEMENT OF COMPREHENSIVE INCOME
12. THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS
